Package model

Class Album

java.lang.Object
model.Album
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Album
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
The Album class contains a list of photos on which various actions can be made. An Album corresponds to exactly one user, and can contains many photos.
Author:
Seok Yim, Mae Khaled
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • addPhoto

      public int addPhoto​(java.lang.String filePath) throws java.io.IOException
      Adds photo to the Album instance.
      Parameters:
      filePath - file path for the to-be-added photo
      Returns:
      0 if successful, 1 if filePath is invalid, 2 if photo already exists, 3 if file path does not specify an image file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an input or output exception occurred

    • addPhotoThroughLink

      public void addPhotoThroughLink​(Photo given)
      Links an already existing Photo instance with this album.
      Parameters:
      given - the Photo instance to be linked with this album

    • deletePhoto

      public boolean deletePhoto​(int index)
      Deletes the Photo that exists at the specified index within the ArrayList photos.
      Parameters:
      index - the index at which the to-be-deleted Photo instance exists
      Returns:
      true if successful, false otherwise

    • rename

      public boolean rename​(java.lang.String name)
      Renames this album.
      Parameters:
      name - the new name for the album
      Returns:
      true if successful, false otherwise

      public void updateDateRange()
      Updates the date range for this album
